Description: African Red Slip Ware wheel-made pottery plate base sherd with stamped decoration. Light orange Tunisian fabric. Dish. Design in the centre of a draped man (Emperor) holding a scepter; either side of him a human bust facing right.
Curator's comments: Notes in Greece and Rome Department register: “bottom of a vase, with incised figures; draped figure with sceptre, standing; on each side a head, stamped. Diam 9 inc. Presented by the Rev. Greville(?) Chester, From Alexandria” "transferred to MLA 12th Jan 1972". Former G&R registration number: 1888,1008.4. New post transfer registration number: 1972,0101.2. Dated to the third quarter of the 6th century AD (or later) by Hayes, who incorporated this piece into his published type series as plate form 104A, image of an emperor, stamp type 230 (Hayes 1972, 265, pl. XVIIIa, referred to under its old registration number of 88.10-8.4). Hayes, J. W. 1972. Late Roman Pottery. London: British School at Rome.
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Rev Greville John Chester (presented by)
Additional IDs: Other BM number: 1888,1008.4 (Former registration number from Dept. Greece and Rome)
